HR Generalist Job at InEvent




        
    

        
        InEvent is an innovative and fast-paced B2B startup that develops intelligent solutions for hospitality and marketing within large enterprises, creating high-level management for the c-level suite and robust operational tools for analysts and managers.

InEvent is a remote event tech company with InEventers in over 13 different countries, speaking together more than 27 different languages. We are a global team. InEventers are a unique team, with a shared Vision of growth and Values. We allow you to be yourself, and we encourage open communication. The most important thing here is not your experience, but your curiosity and passion to learn and grow with us.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Generalist
     

            
    



Job Location: Nigeria
Job type: Contract - This is a Permanent, Full-time position (40h per week), on an Independent Contractor status.

Job Summary


	InEvent is looking for an experienced HR Generalist to provide support to InEventers with HR-related matters and who is fascinated by building a hiring pipeline process.


Responsibilities


	Serve as an advisor in all matters of employee relations and engagement
	Lead full-cycle recruitment within a broad and complex portfolio of business roles
	Play a key role in forecasting and planning conversations, lead recruitment-related projects, and apply expertise to build strong relationships with managers
	Interview, evaluate, and match skilled professionals to InEvent requirements;
	Prepare monthly recruitment reports
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date HR/ personnel records and manage the HRIS;
	Contribute to the continuous improvement of human resources processes, by analyzing various departmental needs, and ensuring alignment with strategies, policies, and processes.
	Contribute to the authoring and editing of InEvent policies and other admin functions
	Liaise with the Marketing and Talent Acquisition Teams to redesign and manage our social media pages with visuals that represent our company
	Developing and executing candidate-facing communication on social media and Job Recruitment sites by establishing social media and online recruiting campaigns
	Designing and implementing branding strategies to develop brand awareness
	Provide strategic support to the Talent Acquisition sector of Human Resources in the areas of culture, values, engagement, and talent attraction
	Assist in people management processes such as onboarding, performance management, benefits, welfare, vacations, terminations, and others.


Pre-Requisites


	2+ years of experience in HR roles, with a focus on employee relations and branding
	Experience with HRIS
	Ability to handle sensitive information with confidentiality and discretion
	Experience with hiring
	Creative thinking and the ability to develop innovative employer brand initiatives.
	Familiarity with digital marketing tools and social media platforms
	Be responsible, have a sense of urgency, and initiative
	Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time-management abilities
	Resilient to learn continuously in a startup
	Exceptional communicator, both written and verbal
	Must speak English fluently
	Must have a personal notebook (Mac or Windows)
	Must have a mobile device (iOS or Android).


Perks


	Global Health Insurance
	Medical insurance
	Paid Time Off (PTO)
	Annual Summits
	Birthday Gift and Work Anniversary Gifts.


Note: If you think this position is for you, bring along your personal notebook (Mac or Windows) and a mobile device (iOS or Android) and come work with us.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Overview


	A reputable professional services firm is seeking an experienced Human Resources Manager with a strong background in HR strategy execution.
	This role is ideal for a dynamic professional who is passionate about driving organizational change, developing people strategies, and aligning HR with business growth objectives.
	You will play a pivotal role in shaping the HR function, working closely with leadership to move the HR team beyond day-to-day operations into a more strategic and advisory space.
	The successful candidate will work closely with the executive team to align HR initiatives with business goals, implement robust performance and succession planning systems, and build a strong talent pipeline for the organization&rsquo;s continued growth.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic HR Planning and Business Partnering:


	Collaborate with leadership to assess business goals and develop HR strategies that align with organizational priorities.
	Lead strategic workforce planning, succession planning, and organizational development initiatives.
	Identify critical roles and skills, assess talent readiness, and drive plans for bench strength and long-term capability development.


Talent Acquisition and Management:


	Oversee full-cycle recruitment in partnership with hiring managers to attract and retain high-quality candidates.
	Develop and improve onboarding and integration programs to ensure new hires transition smoothly and become productive quickly.
	Partner with leaders to identify high-potential talent and implement career pathing strategies.


Performance and Development:


	Design and lead the performance management cycle, including KPIs, goal setting, feedback, reviews, and performance improvement plans.
	Coach managers to drive a culture of accountability, continuous feedback, and employee development.
	Curate learning and development initiatives to support skills growth and future leadership needs.


Employee Engagement and Retention:


	Design and implement strategies to drive employee engagement, motivation, and long-term retention.
	Conduct stay interviews and exit analysis to identify drivers of turnover and areas for improvement.
	Build a positive employee experience, informed by engagement surveys and regular feedback loops.


Compensation and Rewards:


	Work with leadership to maintain competitive, equitable, and performance-based compensation structures.
	Implement incentive programs that drive a high-performance culture.


Employee Relations and Culture


	Provide expert advice on complex employee relations issues while ensuring fair, consistent, and legally compliant practices.
	Champion a culture of respect, collaboration, and inclusion.
	Manage internal investigations and employee grievances with discretion and professionalism.


Change Management and HR Governance


	Support organizational change efforts through communication, planning, and execution.
	Ensure all HR policies and practices are updated, communicated, and aligned with labor laws and industry best practices.


HR Analytics and KPIs:


	Leverage HR metrics and analytics to inform decisions and influence leadership.


Monitor and report on key KPIs, including:


	Employee retention rate
	Time-to-fill vacancies and quality of hires
	Performance improvement outcomes
	Internal promotion rate
	Engagement scores
	Succession coverage for critical roles
	Learning and development initiatives and ROI


Who We&rsquo;re Looking For


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field; a Master&rsquo;s degree or HR certification (e.g., CIPM, SHRM, HRCI) is a strong advantage.
	Minimum of 8 years of progressive HR experience, with at least 3 in a strategic HR leadership or consulting role.
	Proven experience developing and executing HR strategies that drive business outcomes.
	Strong background in performance management, talent development, and succession planning.
	Familiarity with the Balanced Scorecard performance management framework is an added advantage.
	Deep understanding of Nigerian labor law and HR compliance requirements.
	Excellent interpersonal and influencing skills with the ability to engage stakeholders at all levels.
	High proficiency in HRIS tools, analytics, and reporting.
	Ability to operate with discretion in a confidential transition environment.
